titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Sprague deed and title search 1977.372
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:44 +0000.

did.unittitle: George Sprague deed and title search
did.abstract: This collection contains an 1875 deed for land between George Sprague and his wife, Isabella Sprague, of the town of Huntington in Long Island, N.Y., and Herman Nickerson, also of Huntington. Also included is a title search for the property referenced in the deed, which traces the ownership of the property between 1832 and 1875.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); George Sprague deed and title search, 1977.372, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
